title: Pork Loin with Chinese Five Spice Powder
ingredients: 1 to 2 cloves garlic, sliced in slivers
1 teaspoon sesame oil; plus smaller quantity of peanut oil
instructions: Clean and trim the pork loin; pat dry using paper towels.  With a sharp knife poke holes in the pork loin and insert the slivered garlic.
Lightly rub the entire pork loin with oil and then coat it with the Chinese Five-Spice powder and place it, fat side down, in a Dutch oven.  Cover and roast it for 1½ hours.

After the hour and a half, raise the oven heat to 375° F. and remove the lid to the Dutch oven.  Allow the pork loin to continue roasting, uncovered, for an additional 20 minutes; or, until a meat thermometer registers 165° at the pork loin center.

When done, remove from the oven and allow the pork loin to rest within the Dutch oven, on top of the stove, for 15 minutes.  Slice the pork loin in ¼-inch thick slices; arrange the slices on a platter and bring it to the table.
source: Seasoned with love by Karen Haram, Food Section, Express-News, Wednesday, January 25, 2006; recipe from Vanns Spices.
